title: Implement Prelude core functions (id, const, map, filter, foldr, foldl, etc.)
body:
Implement the core Prelude functions, either as Haskell source or built-ins.

**Deliverables:**
- Basic combinators: `id`, `const`, `(.)`, `flip`, `($)`
- List functions: `map`, `filter`, `foldr`, `foldl`, `foldl'`, `head`, `tail`, `null`, `length`, `(++)`, `concat`, `zip`, `unzip`, `take`, `drop`, `reverse`
- Maybe functions: `maybe`, `fromMaybe`, `isJust`, `isNothing`
- Either functions: `either`
- IO functions: `putStrLn`, `putStr`, `print`, `getLine`, `getChar`
- Numeric: `even`, `odd`, `succ`, `pred`
- Boolean: `(&&)`, `(||)`, `not`, `otherwise`
- Conversion: `show` (via Show class)
- Error: `error`, `undefined`
- Unit tests for each function

**Design notes:**
- Most of these are definable in Haskell and can live in a `Prelude.hs` file
- Some (`error`, `undefined`, IO functions) need runtime/primop backing
- `foldl'` needs `seq` which needs the runtime to support strict evaluation
